case_title: NAIMATULLAH and another vs ABDUL QAHAR and 2 others
complaint_summary: Naimatullah alleged that Abdul Qahar and Zia-ud-Din murdered his younger brother, sister Bibi Rubiqa, and nephew Samiullah. He also accused Abdul Qahar of committing Zina-bil-Jabr with Bibi Rubiqa.
investigation_summary: An FIR was registered on 31st January 2003 at Police Station Sariab, Quetta. Accused were arrested and denied allegations during trial. Evidence led to convictions under multiple sections of PPC and Hadood Ordinance.

initial_trial.court: Special Judge Anti Terrorism Court-I, Quetta

conviction_under: Section-10(3) Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hadood) Ordinance, 1979
Section-7 read with Section-21-M(2) of the Anti Terrorism Act, 1997

appeal.reasoning: Accused covered under Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000

convictions.section: 7 read with Section 10 of Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hadood) Ordinance, 1979

petition_for_enhancement.reasoning: Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000 prohibits death penalty for juveniles

judgment_summary: The Juvenile Court convicted Abdul Qahar and Zia-ud-Din for life imprisonment under Section 302(b) PPC for multiple murders and imposed fines. Abdul Qahar was additionally convicted under Section 10 of the Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hadood) Ordinance, 1979. Petition for enhancement of sentence to death was dismissed due to provisions of Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000.
punishment: Life imprisonment for both accused under Section 302(b) PPC for murders. Abdul Qahar received additional 5 years RI and fine under Section 10 of Hadood Ordinance.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition for enhancement of sentence dismissed.
legal_arguments: Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000 prohibits death penalty for juveniles.
Maximum punishment under the Ordinance already applied.
statutes: Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hadood) Ordinance, 1979
witnesses: Neighbor who witnessed accused fleeing the house

witness_statement.Neighbor: Observed Abdul Qahar and Zia-ud-Din fleeing the house with weapons.

key_issues: Applicability of Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000

legal_terms.Ta'zir: Punishment determined by the court under Islamic law.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves juvenile accused convicted for multiple murders and rape. Petition for enhancement of sentence to death dismissed due to legal prohibition under Juvenile Justice System Ordinance, 2000.
